Module com.example.sudoku
Package com.example.sudoku.model

Interface IGame

All Known Implementing Classes:
Game, GameAdapter
public interface IGame
Interface representing the core functionalities of a Sudoku game. This interface defines methods for generating, updating, and validating a 6x6 Sudoku board.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Lady vanessa Matabanchoy

  • Method Details

    • generateSudoku6x6

      ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> generateSudoku6x6()
      Generates a new 6x6 Sudoku board with an initial setup of numbers.
      Returns:
      a 2D ArrayList representing the generated Sudoku board.
      Since:
      1.0

    • currentSudoku6x6

      ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> currentSudoku6x6()
      Retrieves the current state of the 6x6 Sudoku board.
      Returns:
      a 2D ArrayList representing the current Sudoku board.
      Since:
      1.0

    • updateCurrentBoard

      boolean updateCurrentBoard(int row, int col, int value)
      Updates the current Sudoku board with a new value at a specified position.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the board to update.
      col - the column of the board to update.
      value - the new value to place at the specified position.
      Returns:
      true if the update is valid, false otherwise.
      Since:
      1.0

    • fillBoard

      boolean fillBoard(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> board)
      Fills the Sudoku board with valid numbers based on Sudoku rules.
      Parameters:
      board - the Sudoku board to be filled.
      Returns:
      true if the board is successfully filled, false otherwise.
      Since:
      1.0

    • isValidPlacement

      boolean isValidPlacement(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> board, int row, int col, int number)
      Checks whether a given number can be placed in a specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - the Sudoku board.
      row - the row to check.
      col - the column to check.
      number - the number to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the placement is valid, false otherwise.
      Since:
      1.0

    • getcurrentSudoku6x6

      ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> getcurrentSudoku6x6()
      Retrieves the current Sudoku board for further processing.
      Returns:
      a 2D ArrayList representing the current Sudoku board.
